articles.title: Penrith Panthers star Nathan Cleary fined $1,000 for breaching coronavirus social-distancing rules - ABC News
articles.description: NSW Police fine Penrith Panthers star Nathan Cleary $1,000 nearly two weeks after videos and images emerged of him breaking social-distancing rules.
articles.content:
NSW Police has fined Penrith Panthers star Nathan Cleary $1,000 nearly two weeks after images emerged of him breaking social-distancing rules. Key points:
  • NRL player Nathan Cleary was seen with a group of woman in footage taken on Anzac Day

articles.title: NRL to revert to one referee, agrees to rule changes for the rest of the 2020 season - ABC News
articles.description: The Australian Rugby League Commission agrees that only one on-field referee will be used for the rest of the NRL season, while penalties will also no longer be awarded for ruck infringements.
articles.content:
The Australian Rugby League Commission has agreed that only one on-field referee will be used for the rest of the NRL season.
Six more tackles will also be introduced rather than a penalty stoppage for ruck infringements.
The return to one referee has been … [+694 chars]

articles.description: AFL teams may be asked to play home games against West Coast and Fremantle in Queensland in order to restart the season.
articles.content:
